content.verbatim_text: Below is an example of an acceptance procedure provision which reflects Zebracorp preferred position.
content.plain_text: An example of an acceptance procedure provision reflecting Zebracorp's preferred position follows.
content.expert_insight: This introduces a concrete example, which is valuable for understanding how Zebracorp's preferred guidelines translate into contractual language.
content.justification: Introduces a contractual example.
content.implication_company: N/A
content.implication_supplier: N/A
content.source_insight: N/A
content.text: Below is an example of an acceptance procedure provision which reflects Zebracorp preferred position.

content.verbatim_text: “The [Supplier] shall notify Zebracorp in writing when the [Supplier] considers that the [Works] or the relevant milestone has been completed in accordance with this [Agreement], and request [Zebracorp] to initiate the acceptance tests. Within thirty (30) days of receipt of such written notice [Zebracorp] shall, if satisfied that the [Works] or the relevant milestone has been duly completed and the agreed acceptance criteria is met, issue a certificate of acceptance for the milestone in question. Such acceptance can be partial or conditional as indicated in [Zebracorp’] acceptance certificate.
content.plain_text: The Supplier must notify Zebracorp in writing upon completion of works or milestones, requesting acceptance tests. Within 30 days of notice, Zebracorp, if satisfied that works meet criteria, shall issue a certificate of acceptance, which can be partial or conditional.
content.expert_insight: This clause establishes a clear, formal process for initiating and completing acceptance, including specific timelines and Zebracorp's right to issue different types of acceptance.
content.conditions: N/A
content.justification: Outlines a formal acceptance procedure with clear responsibilities and timelines.
content.implication_company: Zebracorp has a 30-day window to evaluate and issue acceptance, and retains discretion over the type of acceptance.
content.implication_supplier: Suppliers are obligated to notify Zebracorp and can expect an acceptance decision within 30 days.
content.source_insight: Example of Zebracorp preferred position
content.text: “The [Supplier] shall notify Zebracorp in writing when the [Supplier] considers that the [Works] or the relevant milestone has been completed in accordance with this [Agreement], and request [Zebracorp] to initiate the acceptance tests. Within thirty (30) days of receipt of such written notice [Zebracorp] shall, if satisfied that the [Works] or the relevant milestone has been duly completed and the agreed acceptance criteria is met, issue a certificate of acceptance for the milestone in question. Such acceptance can be partial or conditional as indicated in [Zebracorp’] acceptance certificate.

content.verbatim_text: In the event that [Zebracorp] is not satisfied that the [Works] and/or the relevant milestone has been completed or if the agreed acceptance criteria or other agreed requirements are not met, [Zebracorp] shall notify [Supplier] thereof within the aforementioned time limit and, at the request of the [Supplier], provide the reasons for refusing the acceptance.
content.plain_text: If Zebracorp is not satisfied that works or milestones meet agreed criteria, it must notify the Supplier within the specified timeframe and, upon request, provide reasons for refusal.
content.expert_insight: This clause protects Zebracorp's right to reject non-compliant work while ensuring transparency by requiring notification and justification, which is good practice for managing supplier relationships.
content.conditions: Zebracorp is not satisfied that works/milestone completed or acceptance criteria/requirements not met.
content.justification: Defines Zebracorp's right to refuse acceptance and the process for doing so.
content.implication_company: Zebracorp has a clear process for rejecting non-compliant deliverables, with an obligation to provide reasons.
content.implication_supplier: Suppliers have a right to be informed of rejection reasons, aiding in remediation.
content.source_insight: Example of Zebracorp preferred position
content.text: In the event that [Zebracorp] is not satisfied that the [Works] and/or the relevant milestone has been completed or if the agreed acceptance criteria or other agreed requirements are not met, [Zebracorp] shall notify [Supplier] thereof within the aforementioned time limit and, at the request of the [Supplier], provide the reasons for refusing the acceptance.

content.verbatim_text: The [Supplier] shall promptly remedy any failures or deficiencies in meeting the acceptance criteria set out below and/or such other agreed requirements, and also rectify and remedy any and all defects and deficiencies identified by [Zebracorp] and/or [Zebracorp’s] customer during the acceptance tests and inform [Zebracorp] in writing upon completing such remedial action. [Zebracorp] will issue the certificate of acceptance only after having satisfied itself that such deficiencies and defects have been duly remedied and rectified, and the [Works] or the relevant part thereof has been completed and all of the requirements for issuing the certificate of acceptance in this [Agreement] have been met.”
content.plain_text: The Supplier must promptly remedy any failures or deficiencies identified during acceptance tests by Zebracorp or its customer, notify Zebracorp upon completion of remedies, and Zebracorp will only issue acceptance after verifying all deficiencies are remedied and all requirements met.
content.expert_insight: This clause places a clear obligation on the supplier to fix issues and ensures Zebracorp retains the final say on acceptance until all conditions are fully met, preventing premature acceptance.
content.conditions: Failures or deficiencies found in meeting acceptance criteria or other agreed requirements.
content.justification: Establishes the supplier's obligation to remedy defects and Zebracorp's right to withhold acceptance until remedies are verified.
content.implication_company: Zebracorp is protected from accepting faulty deliverables and controls the final acceptance based on verified remediation.
content.implication_supplier: Suppliers are obligated to promptly fix identified issues and cannot expect acceptance until these are verified.
content.source_insight: Example of Zebracorp preferred position
content.text: The [Supplier] shall promptly remedy any failures or deficiencies in meeting the acceptance criteria set out below and/or such other agreed requirements, and also rectify and remedy any and all defects and deficiencies identified by [Zebracorp] and/or [Zebracorp’s] customer during the acceptance tests and inform [Zebracorp] in writing upon completing such remedial action. [Zebracorp] will issue the certificate of acceptance only after having satisfied itself that such deficiencies and defects have been duly remedied and rectified, and the [Works] or the relevant part thereof has been completed and all of the requirements for issuing the certificate of acceptance in this [Agreement] have been met.”

content.verbatim_text: The acceptance criteria and acceptance procedures should always be aligned with the end customer acceptance provisions in any such subcontracts that are specifically made for a particular end customer project.
content.plain_text: For subcontracts tied to specific end customer projects, acceptance criteria and procedures must always align with the end customer's acceptance provisions.
content.expert_insight: This is a fundamental and non-negotiable principle for Zebracorp in customer-specific projects, ensuring that its obligations to the end customer are mirrored in its agreements with subcontractors.
content.conditions: Subcontracts specifically made for a particular end customer project.
content.justification: Ensures contractual consistency and prevents Zebracorp from being bound by acceptance terms that are not mirrored in its customer contracts.
content.implication_company: Zebracorp must ensure this critical alignment to avoid financial exposure and operational conflicts.
content.implication_supplier: Suppliers in customer projects must adhere to acceptance terms that are aligned with Zebracorp's end customer requirements.
content.source_insight: N/A
content.text: The acceptance criteria and acceptance procedures should always be aligned with the end customer acceptance provisions in any such subcontracts that are specifically made for a particular end customer project.
